title: High ms on Na server
body: I've made an account on na servers yesterday and i keep having ms problems.Over 160 ms and i normally play with 60 maximum,any thoughts?

replies.body: What you mean by ''I've made an account on na servers'' what server did you originally play on before, when did you play last time and where do you live?

Of course your ping will be high if you play from EU. The NA server you trying to play on is located in Chicago, United States the distans between them is too far. There is nothing you can do to lower your ping, the only thing you can do is moving closer to the server, means you have to move to USA. Good luck.
Oh,i was thinking it will be something about usa.Well i am not moving just to play on a server,i'll play on european servers then.Thanks for clarifying everything{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I'd go ahead and check out our [Log Reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743)!  It should be able to read your network logs and give a better idea of what's happening in those games as well as some potential fixes.  Let me know what you think or if it helps!

Ive been having the same prob alot of people ive played with have to i used the log reader to and it says around 5-10% packet loss and that ive had a few high ping spikes relating to the server so far its only been after the 6.10 patch and thats what everyone else has said too ive tried the solutions and none of them work for me or the people ive talked to. Is their a possibility that its a problem on the servers or something?

When you're seeing consistent packet loss it's usually one of three things:

*  ##**Problems within your network setup/hardware (e.g. Wireless issues, faulty router, etc.)**
To definitively find the cause is usually a process of elimination. If you've gone through the [Log Reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743)/[Connection Troubleshooting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) articles though, then you've already hit what we've found to be the most common causes of network connection issues.


* ##**Failures on the game server**
This is usually the easiest to rule out as if the game server is losing packets, everyone in the game should be experiencing the same issue. If they're not, then it's much more likely to be one of the other two issues.


* ##**Connection errors on the ISP side**
Usually a result of ruling out the other two options. Can also look at doing a network analysis (We usually direct to http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) which will can help to determine if there's a problem in your network or a problem connecting to League specifically. If you're having packet loss on your network in general, I'd contact your ISP for troubleshooting.



Bit of a long explanation, but hopefully you find it useful. Tried to keep it as short and simple as I could.  If you're still getting consistent packet loss only to League, feel free to [send us a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll take a deeper look :D

I have been having this problem too since Saturday. I tried everything but it still stays in between 100-500 ms. I tried repairing the client twice but that did not work. I might try re-installing league of legends.
